sense.gloss: to turn up, to roll up (e.g. sleeves)
to do over and over again, to do relentlessly, to do with reckless abandon, to do continuously
to stage a comeback (against) (in mahjong, horse racing, etc.), to come from behind
to turn over, to turn (pages), to leaf through (a book, etc.)
to tear off, to strip off, to take off, to pull off (e.g. a blanket), to pull up (e.g. floorboards), to tear up
to wind, to coil, to roll, to wear (e.g. turban, scarf)
to envelope, to shroud
to outflank, to skirt
to link (verse)
to move ahead (three hours, etc.), to move up
sweeping (over, across), conquering, overwhelming
to create (a sensation), to cause (a commotion), to give rise to (controversy)
to raise (a cloud of dust), to kick up (dust)
to tuck (e.g. sleeves), to roll up
to push and push, to keep pushing to the end
to roll up, to hoist, to heave up
to take away, to rip off (e.g. money from someone)
to blow up (dust)
to talk on and on, to rattle on, to keep on talking (without pause)
to dash off, to write freely
to blow strongly and continuously
to brag endlessly, to boast ceaselessly
to attack and scatter, to argue vehemently
daily rip-off-a-page calendar, daily pad calendar
to hit repeatedly, to belt hit after hit, to unleash a barrage of blows, to pound away (at a keyboard), to hammer away
page-turner
to be turned up, to be turned inside out, to ride up, to be lifted (e.g. by wind)
rolling up one's sleeves
general overview, general survey
to disperse, to chase away
to pursue relentlessly, to be in hot pursuit
to talk volubly
to sing energetically, to sing with abandon
recouping one's strength for a renewed attack, making another attempt with redoubled efforts
to suddenly assume an antagonistic attitude, to suddenly become defiant, to turn aggressive (in one's manner)
to moon, to point one's naked buttocks at someone, to give someone the brown-eye
twist down
to lift, to turn over, to fold over
winding (coil, armature, etc.)
detour (around a waterfall, etc. when gorge-climbing)
to tuck (e.g. sleeves), to roll up
x: 捲り上げる・まくりあげる

sense.gloss: to arise, to break out, to well up, to burst
rolling one's kimono up to one's waist

sdata.j: カレンの↑裾↑↓すそ↓が↑捲↑↓まく↓れている。
